item.title: Exp rate to 100?
item.dc:creator: @Digital_Hotdogs Digital Hotdogs
item.description:
@Digital_Hotdogs wrote:

Some of the first stuff is just some Ranging junk. Look out for the Melee one, scroll down about 500 lines and it should be around there, in Allstar-Source. Some of the first stuff might be Range, I’m not sure on that. But it might be, it’d be good just to change it incase.

The Melee is not very far from Ranged. Glad I could help. And there is something Allstar added, I think you might be interested in taking out. You can risk all your players getting IP Banned if you put it online.

Players who log on as: Rawr, S0z R4ng3d (Or something), Skillers Mine, can IP Ban. You might want to search for Rawr/Skillers mine. Take out there names from IPBan command.

Read full topic

item.title: Exp rate to 100?
item.dc:creator: @shockys shockys
item.description:
@shockys wrote:

AHHH.
oka, thanks. ill tell you if i have another problemmm.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 17, 2009, 09:35:06 am[/size][hr]ok so i get this.

TotalExp = (double) (750 * hitDiff); TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * CombatExpRate); addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), playerAttack); } else if (FightType == 2) // Agressive { TotalExp = (double) (750 * hitDiff); TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * CombatExpRate); addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), playerStrength); } else if (FightType == 4) // Defensive { TotalExp = (double) (750 * hitDiff); TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * CombatExpRate); addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), playerDefence); } else if (FightType == 3) // Controlled { TotalExp = (double) (700 * hitDiff); TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * CombatExpRate); addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), playerStrength); } TotalExp = (double) (200 * hitDiff); TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * CombatExpRate); addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), playerHitpoints);

^^ i change the number to; 50 correct?

Read full topic

item.title: Exp rate to 100?
item.dc:creator: @Digital_Hotdogs Digital Hotdogs
item.description:
@Digital_Hotdogs wrote:

Open client.java search double TotalExp = 0;

          TotalExp = (double)(50*hitDiff);

50* is the EXP and it’s doubling it. So it is 100, well on mine.
